messages.subject: Tom Cruise
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/31/03 6:53:04 PM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/31/03 6:53:04 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< A long time ago (1980's) Tom Cruise was in the movie "Legend". >>

I finally saw that the other night, or at least most of it.
I didn't know what we were watching but I recognized a MUCH younger Tom
Cruise.
I can see why it got bad reviews, it rambled on too much, not a very clear
plot.
But it was very fun to watch anyway....and the Satan guy was cool.

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson
Burnett

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Tom Cruise
messages.msgSnippet: ... Oh yeah, I do remember that greasy hair look he had in that movie. He was so young back then - you can really tell in the movie. I m a sucker for all those
messages.messageBody:
SandraDodd@... wrote:

>
> In a message dated 1/31/03 4:31:20 PM, curtkar@... writes:
>
> << A long time ago (1980's) Tom Cruise was in the movie "Legend".
> It's a fairy-tale type movie with unicorns and magic and Tim Curry as
> "satan". It got some bad reviews but I remember really liking it! >>
>
> I remember wishing Tom Cruise would move the greasy hair out of his eyes.
>
> Maybe I'd like it if I saw it again. <g>
>

Oh yeah, I do remember that greasy hair look he had in that movie.
He was so young back then - you can really tell in the movie.
I'm a sucker for all those old low-tech fantasy-type movies.
I loved "The Neverending Story", too, as well as "Clash of the Titans".
I can watch those over and over for some reason - I always do when I run
across them on TV.
Oldies but goodies. <g>

Karin

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Tom Cruise
messages.msgSnippet: A long time ago (1980 s) Tom Cruise was in the movie Legend . It s a fairy-tale type movie with unicorns and magic and Tim Curry as satan . It got some bad
messages.messageBody:
A long time ago (1980's) Tom Cruise was in the movie "Legend".
It's a fairy-tale type movie with unicorns and magic and Tim Curry as
"satan". It got some bad reviews but I remember really liking it!
You might want to check it out. You can read reviews for it at amazon.

Karin



>
> > (Holly asked last night what
> > Tom Cruise was in, and we couldn't think of anything offhand that she
> would
> > have seen or might like)
>
> ***Rain Man
> Minority Report
> Born on the 4th of July.***
>
> Far and Away. It's long and slow but the scenery is beautiful and the
> costumes are pretty.
>
> Deb L

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Tom Cruise
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/31/03 4:31:20 PM, curtkar@cox.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/31/03 4:31:20 PM, curtkar@... writes:

<< A long time ago (1980's) Tom Cruise was in the movie "Legend".
It's a fairy-tale type movie with unicorns and magic and Tim Curry as
"satan". It got some bad reviews but I remember really liking it! >>

I remember wishing Tom Cruise would move the greasy hair out of his eyes.

Maybe I'd like it if I saw it again. <g>

I didn't have any idea who he was at the time, and went to see Tim Curry
(whose part wasn't too long). I thought "Who's this
mentally-deficient-looking kid with the long hair?"

I've noted all these suggestions on my "rent these movies" list, though, and
thanks!

Sandra

messages.subject: Tom Cruise
messages.msgSnippet: ... would ... ***Rain Man Minority Report Born on the 4th of July.*** Far and Away.  It s long and slow but the scenery is beautiful and the costumes are
messages.messageBody:
> (Holly asked last night what
> Tom Cruise was in, and we couldn't think of anything offhand that she
would
> have seen or might like)

***Rain Man
Minority Report
Born on the 4th of July.***

Far and Away. It's long and slow but the scenery is beautiful and the
costumes are pretty.

Deb L
